questions.q: Limit test is primarily used to detect what in compounds?
questions.feedback: Limit tests detect trace impurities at or below specified limits.

questions.q: In the chloride limit test, which reagent forms a precipitate with chloride?
questions.feedback: Ag+ reacts with Cl- to form AgCl, seen as opalescence/turbidity.

questions.q: Dilute nitric acid is added before silver nitrate to:
questions.feedback: Acid prevents precipitation of silver carbonate/phosphate from impurities.

questions.q: Pass criterion for the sample is:
options: Sample equal or less turbid than standard

questions.feedback: Standard NaCl solution provides reference turbidity after AgNO3 addition.
Allow time for AgCl to form and develop opalescence.
